title: Personally, as one of the few remaining Ashe players, I'd like an updated passive
body:
On a DPS Marksman, it almost makes no sense to have a passive (with such a high cooldown) that gives a crit attack (0-100 scaling) the more you AREN'T attacking. 
To me, that seems ironic.
Sure, you can go to lane and possibly get an early crit off, but her damage is relatively low at the beginning of the game. Other than that, it can be a good poking tool in lane but often goes unused later on in the game. 
I feel her kit is in a good state right now. She's a good utility ADC. I just think her passive needs a little tweaking and retuning to actually get her to be a viable pick.

^^  That was J/K.  But seriously, it needs to be reworked.  You can't use it in laning phase because cs-ing minions disables it, and in teamfights you only get your first crit guaranteed, and it takes a long time to build up to the next one.  Seriously, Focus at max level is 8 stacks per second.  So at 50% crit chance, you need 50 stacks to reach 100.  That is 6.25 seconds without AA during a teamfight to get a second crit on her passive at max level.  Mid game with 40% crit chance and 6 Focus stacks, it would take 10 seconds of not AA to get a second crit from her passive. You have to cs in lane, so it is worthless there most of the time as well.  

Meanwhile Caitlyn gets "Every 8/7/6 basic attacks, Caitlyn will fire a headshot dealing 150% damage to a champion or 250% damage to a minion." Plus a snare and a jump to escape.  Caitlyn is definitely not OP from this, and Ashe could some work to be viable on this level, too.  I think Riot can do better and give her passive some love.  Hopefully they check some ideas here, and keep the rest of her kit the same.  We don't need any 'compensation' or 'reworks', but I do enjoy Ashe but feel like her passive is holding her back from being viable.  I can't remember the last time I've seen an Ashe do great in SR, decent sure, but not great.

I honestly like her passive a lot. Early game it's really weak I know, because you won't crit as often. Later in the game though, after completing IE and Shiv, you have guaranteed crits that melt at least half the HP of any enemy squishy. It's very useful for skirmishing and poking, and it comes back up really fast.

But maybe tweaking it a bit to make it a bit more reliable and useful especially early game, but keeping the same mechanic would be a good idea.

Her passive is how they tried to make her fit as a support. in a support build, if you get tear into Muramana (which stacks unbelievably fast because your Q procs it twice pre attack) you deal absurd poke early game because of the free crit. If they want her to be a full fledged ADC, then I agree it needs an update, but if they turn her into a utility+poke support, then keeping some manifestation of her current passive would actually be quite good.

Agreed completely, her passive right now is uninteresting and encourages periods of non- activity.  It would be cool if her passive ramped up with either attacks or movement (or both), similar to Statik Shiv.  Especially considering she's supposed to be a kiting Marksmen, rewarding constant attacking somehow would provide much more satisfying gameplay.

Maybe it could stack faster, but instead of movement speed like Shiv, make it based on slowed targets?    When targets are slowed, the numbers move up quickly, similar to how Shiv moves up quickly during fast movements.  This would give her some damage during kiting, and execute ability during chasing.

Early on it's mostly just good for a single crit of harass when you get back into lane.
Later on it's good for going between skirmishes.
Though to be honest, I wish the cooldown on it would decrease as you level up so you could stack it faster between skirmishes.
